questions.explanation:
Carla.

	Carla figured out she got better tips when she was pregnant. She had her baby earlier in the season so to continue getting tips she pretended to be pregnant. At one point, the "baby" was moved from her middle to her side.

questions.text: What did Sam say would be romantic?
options: Carving their initials in the bar
questions.explanation:
Having their buns tattooed.

	Diane carved S.M. and D.C. in the bar. Sam was annoyed by this as he found it very destructive. Diane claimed that it was romantic. Sam replied, "If you want romance, we could get our buns tattooed."

questions.text: Who pulled a gun out at the bar?
questions.explanation:
Andy.

	Andy wanted to get caught because he believed life outside of prison was too hard. Diane decided she wanted to help him and told Sam to tell the police not to come.

questions.text: What did Andy want to be?
questions.explanation:
an actor.

	Diane had experience in the acting field and believed she could help Andy. She invited a professor of hers to see Andy act so he could judge if Andy had the potential to be an actor.

questions.text: What play did they do a scene from?
questions.explanation:
Othello.

	"Othello" is a William Shakespeare tragedy. Diane and Andy acted out the strangulation scene between Othello and Desdemona.

questions.text: What did Andy do time for?
questions.explanation:
murder.

	Andy once killed a waitress. He often imagined his hands were claws and in "Diane's Perfect Date" he told Sam he heard voices.

questions.text: What sport were they watching on TV when Diane turned off the TV?
questions.explanation:
boxing.

	Diane said the TV was distracting Andy and her from rehearsing. Norm said to Sam, "I hope she's showing you one heck of a good time." The bar patrons were upset that Diane turned off the TV since they were all big sports fans.

questions.text: What was the name of the professor that came to see the scene?
questions.explanation:
Professor Dewitt.

	Professor Dewitt was played by Severn Darden. He also played Dr. Barazini in the movie "Back to School". He was one of the first people on "Second City TV".

options: Diane told him he couldn't act
questions.explanation:
Diane kissed Sam.

	Andy developed a crush on Diane while working with her. He told her he loved her and she replied that she loved him as well. She meant as a friend, but he took it as romantic love.

Andy tried to kill Diane.

	During the strangulation scene of "Othello" Andy really did try to strangle Diane. He said to her, "I saw you kissing Sam! I saw you kissing Sam!" Sam pulled him off Diane, and Cliff and Norm sat on him so he couldn't escape.
